intro: Drypetes nitida, commonly known as the white-flowered drypetes, is a small evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in axillary umbels, followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
